intro: Cleome hirsuticaulis, commonly known as the hairy stickseed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Cleome hirsuticaulis is an annual plant that is relatively easy to grow, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking low-maintenance ornamental plants.
